alert.note: Alert for Knox (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 23 at 5:36PM EDT until July 23 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Knox County in north central Ohio... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 535 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Centerburg, or 11 miles southwest of Mount Vernon, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon, Fredericktown, Gambier, Utica, Danville, Martinsburg, Gann and Bladensburg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
